property_tycoon.model

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • property_tycoon.model.Card

  • public abstract class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a card. This class is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly. Subclasses of this class are not publicly exposed and thus cannot be instantiated directly either. The only way to create a Card instance is to use the static create() methods (recommended) or to extend this class (not recommended).
    Version:
    02/05/2018
    Author:
    meme-team

      static class  Card.Group
      Represents a deck of cards.

      • getPropertyChangeSupport

        protected java.beans.PropertyChangeSupport getPropertyChangeSupport()
        Returns the PropertyChangeSupport associated with this Card object that is used to manage Java Bean property change event handlers. Any time the value of a property in this class changes this object should be used to notify observers.
        Returns:
        The PropertyChangeSupport associated with this Card.

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Registers the specified property change listener with this Card object.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object for bound updates.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Unregisters the specified property change listener with this Card object.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object for bound updates.

      • getActionCount

        public abstract int getActionCount()
        Gets the number of action choices associated with this card. For a single action card this method returns 1.
        Returns:
        The number of action choices associated with this card.

      • getActionDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getActionDescription(int action)
        Gets the description of the specified action.
        Parameters:
        action - The index of the action in question.
        Returns:
        The description of the action at the specified index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the action index is out of bounds.

      • getDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the description of this card. For a single action card calling this method is equivalent to calling getActionDescription(0).
        Returns:
        The description of this card.

      • getGroup

        public abstract Card.Group getGroup()
        Gets the group to which this card belongs.
        Returns:
        The group to which this card belongs, or null if this card has no group.

      • setGroup

        protected abstract void setGroup(Card.Group group)
        Sets the group to which this card belongs. This method should only be called by Card$Group. Subclasses should provide an implementation of this method, but should never call it themselves.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this card already has a group.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is null.

      • isGrouped

        public abstract boolean isGrouped()
        Indicates if this card is a member of a group.
        Returns:
        true if this card is a member of a group; false otherwise.

      • isChoice

        public final boolean isChoice()
        Indicates if this card offers a choice of action.
        Returns:
        true if this card offers a choice of action; false otherwise.

      • isImmediate

        public abstract boolean isImmediate()
        Indicates if this card must be used immediately when drawn, or if it can be kept for later use.
        Returns:
        true if this card must be used immediately; false if it can be kept for later use.

      • isUseable

        public abstract boolean isUseable()
        Indicates if at least one action associated with this card is usable at this time. This method should always return true for an immediate use card.
        Returns:
        true if at least one action associated with this card is usable; false otherwise.

      • isUseable

        public abstract boolean isUseable(int action)
        Indicates if the specified action is usable at this time.
        Parameters:
        action - The index of the action in question.
        Returns:
        true if the specified action is usabl;, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the action index is out of bounds.

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Indicates if this card is a valid proxy that can be used access mutator methods of an underlying real property. This method always returns true for real cards. Any attempt to call a mutator method on a proxy card will raise an exception is this method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if this card is a valid proxy; false otherwise.

      • use

        public final void use()
        Uses this card, executing its associated action and replacing it in its owner Group. This is a convenience method for using a single action card without specifying the action index explicitly. Calling this method on a single action card is equivalent to calling use(0). Calling this method on a choice card will raise an exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this card is a choice card.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this card is not useable at this time.

      • use

        public abstract void use(int action)
        Uses the card, executing the specified action and replacing it in its owner group. Raises an exception if the specified action is not usable at this time.
        Parameters:
        action - The index of the action to execute when using this card.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the action index is out of bounds.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if action is not usable at this time.

      • isOwned

        public abstract boolean isOwned()
        Indicates if this card is currently owned.
        Returns:
        true if this card is currently owned; false otherwise.

      • getOwner

        public abstract Player getOwner()
        Gets the player that currently owns this card.
        Returns:
        The player that currently owns this card, or null if this card has no owner.

      • setOwner

        protected abstract void setOwner(Player owner)
        Sets the owner of this card. This method should only be called by Card$Group. Subclasses should provide an implementation of this method, but should never call it themselves.
        Parameters:
        owner - The player to set as the owner.
